This emulates
, but changes the timing. The array parameters,
, should have only one element if that same element applies to all samples.
All parameters are copied; on return, the caller can release them, free them, or reuse them. Any
that has been set on the original buffer isn’t copied because it’s no longer relevant. On return, the caller owns the returned
, and must release it when done with it.

abstract.text: Represent time-based audio-visual assets with essential data types.
A datatype that represents an item count.
A reference to a buffer of media data.
Creates a sample buffer that contains a range of samples from an existing sample buffer.
Creates a copy of a sample buffer.
Creates a copy of a sample buffer with new timing information.
A collection of timing information for a sample in a sample buffer.
Errors that occur when processing sample buffer objects.
A reference to a CFAllocator object.
A pointer for accessing data of a specific type.
A pointer for accessing and manipulating data of a specific type.
